required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Twenty-six Week Extension Trial of Org 50081 (Esmirtazapine) in Outpatients With Chronic Primary Insomnia (176003/P05721/MK-8265-007)
clinical_study.official_title: A Twenty-six Weeks, Open-label Extension Trial to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Org 50081 (Esmirtazapine) in Outpatients With Chronic Primary Insomnia Who Completed Clinical Trial Protocol 21106

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is a 26-week, open label extension trial to investigate safety and explore efficacy of esmertazapine in participants with insomnia who completed protocol 21106/P05701/MK-8265-002 (NCT00631657).

clinical_study.why_stopped: This trial was stopped prematurely due to the Sponsor's decision not to continue the development of esmertazapine for this indication.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Sleep Time (TST)
primary_outcome.description: TST was defined as the time recorded for sleep diary question 6 "how much time did you actually spend sleeping" as reported by the participants using a LogPad (hand-held electronic data capture device). Baseline was defined as the TST from the last week of the base study. Daily diary data were converted to weekly averages. For each treatment week the non-missing diary data of that week were taken into account; if a treatment week had three non-missing morning diaries or less, the data of the previous week were taken into account, weighing the data of both weeks, using the number of observed diaries as weights (weighted mean); if no diary data were available for a treatment week the data were considered as missing and were not imputed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body whether or not considered related to the study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinuing Due to AEs
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body whether or not considered related to the study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sleep Latency (SL)
secondary_outcome.description: SL was defined as the time recorded for sleep diary question 3 "how long did it take you to fall asleep', " as reported by the participants using a LogPad (hand-held electronic data capture device). Baseline was defined as the SL from the last week of the base study. Daily diary data were converted to weekly averages. For each treatment week the non-missing diary data of that week were taken into account; if a treatment week had three non-missing morning diaries or less, the data of the previous week were taken into account, weighing the data of both weeks, using the number of observed diaries as weights (weighted mean); if no diary data were available for a treatment week the data were considered as missing and were not imputed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Wake Time After Sleep Onset (WASO)
secondary_outcome.description: WASO was defined as the time recorded for sleep diary question 5 "how much time were you awake, after falling asleep initially" as reported by the participants using a LogPad (hand-held electronic data capture device). Baseline was defined as the WASO from the last week of the base study. Daily diary data were converted to weekly averages. For each treatment week the non-missing diary data of that week were taken into account; if a treatment week had three non-missing morning diaries or less, the data of the previous week were taken into account, weighing the data of both weeks, using the number of observed diaries as weights (weighted mean); if no diary data were available for a treatment week the data were considered as missing and were not imputed.

arm_group.description: Participants receive esmirtazapine 4.5 mg tablet, orally, once daily (QD) for up to 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sign written informed consent
- Completed clinical trial 21106/P05701/MK-8265-002
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any (serious) adverse event, medical condition or required concomitant medication deemed relevant for exclusion in trial 21106/P05071/MK-8265-002 as judged by the investigator
- Were significantly non compliant with protocol criteria and procedures of trial 21106/P05701/MK-8265-002, as judged by the investigator
- Pregnancy

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants who completed P05701 (Base study NCT00631657) were eligible to enroll on P05721 (Extension study).

group.title: Esmirtazapine
group.description: Participants receive esmirtazapine 4.5 mg tablet, orally, once daily (QD) for up to 6 months

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Could not cooperate, unrelated to trial

group.title: Esmirtazapine
group.description: Participants receive esmirtazapine 4.5 mg tablet, orally, once daily (QD) for up to 6 months

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Total Sleep Time (TST)
outcome.description: TST was defined as the time recorded for sleep diary question 6 "how much time did you actually spend sleeping" as reported by the participants using a LogPad (hand-held electronic data capture device). Baseline was defined as the TST from the last week of the base study. Daily diary data were converted to weekly averages. For each treatment week the non-missing diary data of that week were taken into account; if a treatment week had three non-missing morning diaries or less, the data of the previous week were taken into account, weighing the data of both weeks, using the number of observed diaries as weights (weighted mean); if no diary data were available for a treatment week the data were considered as missing and were not imputed.
outcome.population: The All-Subjects-Treated (AST) population consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of esmertazapine in the extension study.

reported_events.time_frame: Nonserious AEs were collected from first dispensing of study drug up to 7 days after last dose of study drug. Serious AEs were collected from first dispensing of study drug up to 30 days after last dose of study drug.

group.title: Esmirtazapine
group.description: Participants receive esmirtazapine 4.5 mg tablet, orally, once daily (QD) for up to 6 months

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated due to the Sponsor's decision not to continue development of esmertazapine for this indication.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
